msItem.p: The Passion of Saint Christopher, The Wonders of the East (illustrated), The Letter of Alexander the Great to Aristotle, Beowulf, and the Judith fragment.

objectDesc.p: Parchment manuscript, 118 folios. For further details, see Ker, N. R. Catalogue of manuscripts containing Anglo-Saxon, Oxford, 1957.

Vitellius A. xv is written in two scribal stints. The two scribes are contemporary with one another, but dissimilar in character, (2) being a late type of square Anglo-Saxon minuscule and (1) a smaller, more pointed and delicate script, influenced by Caroline minuscule.

editorialDecl.p: Diplomatic and interpretative edition, with a special focus on the illustrations accompanying the text.
editorialDecl.correction: The illegible parts due to fire damage will be added from the Tiberius Old English version.

normalization.p: Modern puntctuation and capitalisation has been editorially added. Words have been separated or united after being transcribed from scriptio continua.

glyph.glyphName: LATIN SMALL LETTER THORN WITH STROKE
LATIN CAPITAL LETTER THORN WITH STROKE
LATIN SMALL LETTER Y WITH DOT ABOVE
